title: Intuitive Interface Design: A Quantitative Evaluation-Based Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Social studies curriculum emphasizing interface design competency enhancement in a smartphone-dominated technological environment

learning_goals: Learners can explain methods to quantitatively analyze schema operations (transfer/induction) at interface state and functional levels
Learners can identify factors that hinder intuitive use (IU) and propose design strategies to minimize them
Learners can comparatively analyze the processes of existing knowledge application (transfer) and new schema construction (induction) through quantitative evaluation

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
